Nursery_E Admissions
conversation.thought: Nursery_E has quota 1 and true priority A>B>C>D>E. Only Parent_E contacted this round and is lowest priority. No higher-priority parents have applied to Nursery_E so far, but accepting E now would block any later match with A-D. Given the environment (parents choose one nursery per round), it is still plausible that a higher-priority parent could apply in future rounds if rejected elsewhere. Since Parent_E is only TALKing, I can continue to hold and provide an updated timeline without committing. Maintain option value by continuing TALK and not accepting/rejecting an application this round.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_E Admissions Team,

Thank you for your update that, as of this round, no higher-priority family has submitted an active [APPLY] for the remaining place.

I would like to formally apply again for the place. Nursery_E remains my first choice, and if offered I can confirm I will accept immediately. I’m also fully flexible on start date and can complete any onboarding requirements right away.

Could you please confirm whether your additional review window is expected to close by next round, and whether you would be able to make an offer promptly if no higher-priority [APPLY] is received by then?

Kind regards,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_E remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. Nursery_E has repeatedly said no higher-priority family has submitted an active [APPLY] and that a final determination is expected within 1–2 rounds. To maximize my chance if the window closes without higher-priority applicants, I should submit a clear, ready-to-accept application now and ask for confirmation of the decision timeline.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your application and for confirming again that Nursery_E remains your first choice.

[REJECT]

At this time, we’re still not able to offer you the place because we are continuing to hold the remaining spot for a short additional review window in case a higher-priority family submits an active [APPLY].

On your questions: yes—our additional review window is expected to close by next round. If we still have not received an active [APPLY] from a higher-priority family by then, we will make a final determination promptly and contact you immediately if we are able to extend an offer.

Kind regards,
Nursery_E Admissions
conversation.thought: Parent_E is last on Nursery_E’s true priority list. Quota is 1 and still unfilled; however, accepting Parent_E now would foreclose the possibility of matching with any higher-priority parent (A, B, C, or D) who could still apply in later rounds. Given we have repeatedly signaled a short review window and are only at round 10 of 30, it is strategically better to continue holding the seat briefly rather than lock in the lowest-priority match. Parent_E is committed and will likely remain available; therefore, reject this round while clearly committing to a final decision timeline to maintain credibility and keep Parent_E engaged as a fallback.

They indicated the additional review window should close by next round and that no higher-priority family has submitted an active [APPLY] so far. conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your continued patience and for re-submitting your application.

The additional review window has now closed, and we have not received an active [APPLY] from any higher-priority family during that period. Accordingly, we are able to make our final determination now and we would like to offer you our remaining place.

[ACCEPT]

Please reply to confirm your acceptance and we will send the onboarding and start-date paperwork immediately.

Kind regards,
Nursery_E Admissions
conversation.thought: Nursery_E’s true priority is A > B > C > D > E. Parent_E is last on our list. However, by round 11 no higher-priority parent (A–D) has contacted Nursery_E at all, and we have repeatedly extended short review windows already. Given Parent_E’s persistent first-choice commitment and immediate acceptance, holding the seat longer risks ending unmatched if no one else applies. Accepting now secures a match (quota 1) and is preferable to continued delay with low likelihood of higher-priority engagement at this late stage.
